newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks close at year high with Dow support.
newsitem.headline: French stocks close at year high with Dow support.

text.p: French shares closed at a closing high for the year but off their best levels on Tuesday, after a rally on the back of Wall Street's bull run, traders said.
Alcatel fell sharply in late trading on market talk it had won the bidding for electronics group Thomson but the missiles activities were being sold to Lagardere, traders said.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index closed up 24.66 points or 1.15 percent at 2,168.28 while the CAC-40 futures contract was up at 2,172.5 from a settle of 2,149 on Monday.
The year high hit today by the CAC-40 index is 2,176.45.
The life high of the CAC-40 stands at 2,360.98 since February 1994.
Share volume today was 6.65 billion francs.
Turnover in Alcatel was 240 million francs, making it one of the biggest volumes. It was down 2.22 percent at 444.90.
Lagardere rose 2.94 percent to 133.10. The books-to-missiles conglomerate wants to merge its Matra unit with Thomson-CSF if it won Thomson SA.
Cie Generale des Eaux firmed 5.08 percent to 620 francs and had higher highest volume of 804 million francs, following an analysts meeting on Monday's first-half results
Its SGE construction unit ended up 14.74 percent at 102 francs, buoyed by restructuring plans.
